meanings.definition: The act or process of dividing something into separate sections or categories.
meanings.sent1: The compartmentalizations of the storage room made it easy to find things.
meanings.sent2: The compartmentalizations of the company's departments helped improve efficiency.
meanings.sent3: The party planner's compartmentalizations of snacks and drinks were a hit with the guests.
meanings.sent4: Her compartmentalizations of work and personal life were like having two separate worlds.
meanings.sent5: The compartmentalizations of the puzzle pieces made it easier to assemble.

meanings.definition: The state of keeping different parts of something separate from each other.
meanings.sent1: The compartmentalizations of the bookshelves kept fiction and non-fiction books apart.
meanings.sent2: The compartmentalizations of the data ensured privacy and security.
meanings.sent3: The chef's compartmentalizations of ingredients led to a delicious dish.
meanings.sent4: The compartmentalizations of emotions can sometimes lead to misunderstandings.
meanings.sent5: The compartmentalizations of the garden made each section unique.
